DataElement.preferredName: EQ-5D-Y Questionnaire v1.0 2 Washing or Dressing Self-Care Today Status 3 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Youths' stated observation of their health state today as related to self-care, using a 3 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: European Quality of Life Five Dimension Three Level Youth Questionnaire Washing or Dressing Self-Care Today Status
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standardized rating scale which is used as a measure of health outcome for children and adolescents aged 8-18. This instrument is a descriptive system consisting of 5 dimensions: mobility, self-care, usual activity, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression. Each dimension has 3 levels ranging from no problem to extreme problem or incapable, which are assessed by the patient._A question about an individual's current self-care ability with washing or dressing._A condition or state at a particular time.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A three point ordered reference standard that describes current health state related to washing and dressing self-care using the EQ-5D-Y questionnaire.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: A Lot of Problems with Washing or Dressing

ValueMeaning.preferredName: A Lot of Problems with Washing or Dressing
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has or had a lot of problems with washing or dressing their self.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has or had a lot of problems with washing or dressing their self.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Quality of Life Measures (Patient Reported Outcomes - Health Related Quality of Life)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.
